title: Valerian is great!  I've used if for years, I sleep well, and there are no side-effects.
body: About 12 years ago I developed insomnia, but I didn't want to take prescription medications after learning about all of the side-effects that go along with prescription sleep-aids - e.g. daytime drowsiness, dependency, etc.  After doing some research, I discovered valerian (which is a natural/herbal product) which was widely used as a sleep aid prior to the 1940's when drug companies developed sedatives and doctors started giving prescriptions for them to their patients with insomnia.  So, I thought I would give NOW Valerian Root a try, and I was not disappointed.  I currently take 2 capsules about an hour before bedtime every night, I sleep great, and I have no trouble whatsoever getting out of bed when my alarm goes of about 7 1/2 hours later.  If I forget to take it, there are no withdrawal symptoms, I just don't sleep very well that night.  AND, as far as I know, no one ever died from an overdose of valerian.

body: I like valerian root and use it a couple times a week usually. I usually only took 2 but on a weekend or when I don't have to get up early, I would sometimes take 3 just to ensure I didn't lay awake.  These have worked for me just as well, taking 2.  I have looked at some of the similar products and comments about it, etc., and I can say for me, they work--for whatever reason.  I do take them an hour before I go to bed.  If I end up staying up a little later, it's not like you are so sleepy you can't stand up.  They seem to really start working when you lay down in bed and stop moving around, whether that is 40 minutes or an hour and 10 minutes.  I think you could potentially get dependent on these if you used them every night.  It would be terrible to forget how to go to sleep, so I don't use them every day.  I do not feel groggy in the morning, like I have with other PM products, that is one of the reasons I like valerian root.  I would recommend, if you're not sure buy one bottle and share it with someone until you're sure whether you think it helps.  I usually get up at least once in the night to use the bathroom, when I have taken this, I will go right back to sleep, even if I have to get up in an hour.

title: Don't mix with Serotonin increaser medications.
body: I bought these to see if it would relieve some of my schizophrenia, anxiety, and tension. I took 2 and didn't really notice anything until about 8 or more caps, and one time after taking about 12 capsules total I did notice a more sense of calm overall. The bad thing is these smell like a wet dog mixed with gym level sweat odor with some vomit. I've taken most of the bottle and decided to throw it away because of the ridiculous horrible smell. I also noticed after taking 12 capsules late one night I took my prescribed drug Seroquel about 1 1/2 hours later to go to bed and it had a very strange reaction with it. I believe this Valerian increases the neurotransmitter serotonin amount and so does the drug Seroquel. When these two were combined and they both kicked in (extreme dose of 12 caps of V root plus 600mg of Seroquel) I ended up tripping so hard I couldn't make out any kind of object I looked at. My vision was completely distorted I had no spacial awareness and my respiratory rate slowed and it was hard to breathe and I was was tripped out so hard I couldn't even stand up or walk around. I literally could not distinguish my hand in front of my face so I just layed down and waited for it to pass and once it did, I pretty much went into a coma induced sleep. Barely dreamed (I usually have very lucid and realistic dreams every night) but woke up feeling great.

title: Excellent alternative to prescribed medications for anxiety and stress
body: Prescribed medications have long lists of side effects, and many of them are very addicting. Valerian Root, however, is non-addicting and as far as my experience indicates, without side effects. It is wonderful at reducing anxiety and so-called 'stress meltdowns'. It can be taken at specific times daily, for overall assistance to stressful moods, and can be taken whenever you feel a meltdown coming on. It has never caused drowsiness in anyone I know, but it definitely does help you relax, so perhaps that is why so many people use it to help them sleep. I know several psychiatrists who instruct their patients to use this for a relaxant in lieu of prescribed medications and only resort to prescriptions when the natural alternatives are not sufficient for the patient. Good to have folks who lean toward the natural alternatives first, artificial drugs second. Fewer problems that way.

title: a natural solution to insomnia
body: My experience with Valerian root, after using it for about 10 years now, is that is provides a natural remedy for those sleepless nights.  I have found that I personally need to get this in my system for a few nights before I have the full effect.  After that, I enjoy restful sleep for 7-8 hours.  A good side to this is that if you take the 3 capsules the recommended 30 minutes before retiring, it will not make you drowsy, so if you have to delay your bedtime, you won't be fighting off sleep.  Rather what Valerian root has done for me is that is helps me to fall asleep and STAY asleep.  No more waking up at 2 a.m. and watching the clock for three hours!  I still wake up during the night, but I drift back off pretty quickly.  What a relief!  My own experience has also been that I don't have to take these nightly once I get over a hump.  I just tend to use these when I can tell that a pattern of sleeplessness is developing again.  I have found these to be safe for me.  I have not noticed any unpleasant side effects. title: Works like a charm!
body: I had my doubts when I purchased this pill because there are so many paid reviews out there, but let me tell you, this one actually works. The back of the bottle says it promotes relaxation and helps sleep, it does. I suffer from anxiety, I get anxious during class presentations, group work, public speaking, anything that has to do with me being put on the spot. Not only do I suffer from anxiety but I also get the embarrassing symptoms that come with anxiety: sweating, rapid heartbeat, hot flashes, etc. It got to a point where I wanted to avoid going out to places so I wouldn't get anxious and begin sweating and feel embarrassed. I wasn't expecting too much from this pill, but I was surprised with the results. The recommended dosage is three pills, but since I take these before school, not bed, I decided to just take one to see how my body reacted to it. Well, I took one and about one hour later I realized my heart wasn't beating as fast as it usually does. I would get really nervous before this one class because the Prof would randomly call on people, but after taking this pill I felt relaxed. Yes, I was still worried about being called on, but my heart wasn't racing and I wasn't sweating! I didn't feel numb either, its hard to explain. I guess, for the first time in many years I felt "normal" like I didn't have to worry about the "what ifs" of sweating, anxiety, and nervousness. I was also worried this pill was going to make me sleepy but I didn't feel sleepy or drowsy all day. I don't want to become dependent on these pills so I take them only when I really feel like I need the help. I also only take one sometimes two if I feel super nervous, but I feel like one pill will suffice. I think if I were to take three then I might feel sleepy but not sure since I haven't taken more than two. The pills are big and STINK! Take them before you leave your house so you won't be embarrassed to open the bottle in public because the smell will travel quickly! haha. The smell is no big deal compared to what the pill actually does for you. Anyway, I recommend this pill for people who easily get anxious, nervous, have a hectic lifestyle, suffer from stress, etc. It worked for me and I'm so glad I found this because I didn't want to get prescribed medication.

title: Puts me right to sleep
body: I have used Valerian Root for years to help relax me and lead me into dreamworld. I don't need help going to sleep, usually. But, when I find myself tossing and turning, mind unable to relax, I love Valerian Root to break through all that. I've only taken prescription sleep aids or over the counter sleep aids a few times. HATE the way they make me still a bit drowsy in the morning. I seem to also be in a grumpy mood after taking them. Once I found out about Valerian Root, I've never taken another prescribed or OTC drug for sleep purposes. I'd say within 45 minutes of taking 2 to 3 Valerian Root capsules, I start to drift away. And, it's not a super, knocked out sleep. I'm able to wake up if I need to during the night. The next day....no drowsiness. I like Valerian Root so much that I've done a lot of reading on the use of this herbal aid and have found that it's not toxic, doesn't interact with anything other than increased drowsiness with some medications. It can be a diuretic if taken at higher dosages - I found out the hard way by taking another manufacturer's VR product with a higher dosage then finding myself waking up to pee after about 4 hours - kinda defeating the purpose of using it.

I found that little factoid relevant because, if there were health concerns, they probably would have shown up by now. I like this brand because the doses are lighter than most. title: Well I dunno

When the bottle arrived he opened the bottle, and took a small sniff of the contents and threw the bottle down. This is not  anything to do with the company I am rating. All Valerian root smells like a fish corpse in the hot sun packed in a cooler for 10 days. It took 3 more days for the small brained man to be convinced to try it. It clearly states take 2. He decided to take 4. WITH beer. And several hits of medical grade pot. Bad idea. He started to play guitar and really groove with the moment of the new nature herb of relaxation. An hour later he hit the floor. Four hours later he woke to loud deep flatulence coming from 3 directions. His nether region and the nether regions of both his dogs. You see when the redneck fell asleep he forgot to put them up off the table and for some reason the 2 dogs thought the rotting fish smell tablets smelled like cupcakes and ate them all. Very sad. Both dogs were frantically circling the small brain man and sniffing the air like hounds after coons. The redneck jumped up let the dogs out and felt an explosive power trying to escape his nether region. He then preceded to sit on the toilet for the rest of the night while nodding off every few minutes. Point is this stuff makes you sleepy, kind of like a Tylenol PM however does it calm nerves? No. Panic attacks? No. Its just an herb which has an effect on certain people to get a little sleepy. I cant make a total judgement on this product because I have no use of it, considering I take Xanax. I only observe what it has done for others. I give it a 3 for light weights who want to feel sleepy. I give it a zero for anything that is sedating. I will say The company Natures Way is a highly recommended company with high quality products. Do not take with beer or take more than 2 or on an empty tummy. If your a redneck it might not be good either.

title: A game changer for those who have trouble sleeping...

title: It worked!
body: I am not a believer in herbs. I don't think natural treatments are effective. I prefer to use a drug over a natural alternative. In fact, I was taking Benadryl for YEARS. At the rate of three a night no less to make sure I get and stay asleep. I was struggling every morning when that 6AM alarm went off for work. Oh how bad I just wanted to sleep. It was so painfully difficult. I was into work early in the morning and spent most of my morning trying to "burn off" the Benadryl. My husband would ask "still Benadryly?" when I was still hopelessly sedated in the morning. But it helped ensure I got a full night's sleep.

title: Helpful for Mild Insomnia/Restlessness
body: This supplement is helpful when used as a sleep-aid after a stressful day, or for when you need to get back into a good sleep schedule.  The herbs and amino acids in this supplement are naturally relaxing, and the melatonin tells your body it's time to go to sleep.  This is not going to knock you out or make you fall asleep.  For more severe sleep issues, you are definitely going to need something stronger.  However, I do find it helpful for those nights when I know I should go to bed, but I'm still stimulated from the stressful day I just had.  I see the relatively small amount of melatonin in this product as a plus, as it gives you more flexibility on the dosage.  If you just need a little help getting to sleep, you can take one capsule--if you want the full dose, take two capsules.  Note that the serving size is two capsules for this supplement, so that does make this product a little pricey overall if you take two every night (at the current price that's ~20 dollars/month).

Enter Driftoff... I've been taking it for a week now and my sleep is completely back to normal!! Falling asleep quickly and sleeping all night! I've recommended it to all of my family and friends. If nothing else it's worth a try!! I had also tried just plain melatonin and that did nothing. Based on the other reviews it seems like Driftoff may not work for everyone but it definitely worked for me!!

title: Best thing for anxiety or insomnia!
body: This is the first time I have purchased Valerian root that wasn't in tea bags but this seems to be very good quality and much more cost effective. Yes it does have an odd and strong smell to it but after awhile I got used to it and don't even notice it anymore. When using this to help me sleep I fill a tea ball with around a teaspoon of the Valerian root and steep it in very hot (just bellow boiling) water and keep it covered for 15 mins. Covering it is very important if you want to make it strong. When I use it during the day for general anxiety I don't cover it and steep for around 5 mins. That way I feel relaxed but not like I want to go to sleep. If you haven't used this before I would recommend testing it out at night in case you are sensitive to it cause a small amount might make you really sleepy. I am really happy with this product, it has helped me cut back on meds for anxiety and insomnia.

title: Two uses!
